definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: In Nigeria's press, Cecilia Ibru is referred to as the First Lady of Banking.
sentences.chinese: 在尼日利亞新聞界，伊布魯被稱爲銀行界第一夫人。

sentences.english: As for Cambodia, the media's themes were familiar.
sentences.chinese: 至於柬埔寨，新聞界的調子是久已熟知的。

sentences.english: He expressed the hope that the friends from the media could continue to offer their attention and support to China-Uzbekistan friendly cause.
sentences.chinese: 希望烏新聞界朋友繼續關心和支持中烏友好事業。

sentences.english: He is an old journalistic acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 他是我在新聞界的一位舊交。

sentences.english: The report received accolades from the press.
sentences.chinese: 這篇報道受到新聞界的讚揚。

sentences.english: It is taken for granted by the public-at-large.
sentences.chinese: 公衆把新聞界的影響力看成是理所當然的。

sentences.english: He was nobbled by the press who wanted details of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 新聞界緊盯住他不放，要了解事件的詳情。

sentences.english: Newspaper is in the monopoly power of journalism already subsidise , competition will be permanent exist.
sentences.chinese: 報紙在新聞界的壟斷力已消退，競爭將永久存在。

sentences.english: Even Government ministers talk openly to the press of the problem of corruption," Hellman says.
sentences.chinese: 連政府部長們都公開對新聞界談論腐敗問題。

sentences.english: He was arrested by Los Angeles police and the media made a fuss of it. I really feel sorry for him.
sentences.chinese: 洛山磯的警察逮捕了他，新聞界大肆宣揚。

sentences.english: All the achievements are results of care and efforts by the leaders of the two states. The social communities including the media also made important contribution.
sentences.chinese: 兩國社會各界，包括新聞界也作出了重要貢獻。

sentences.english: He had been subject to a campaign of innuendo in the press.
sentences.chinese: 他一直受到新聞界指桑罵槐的影射。

sentences.english: He was arrested by Los Angeles police and the media made a fuss of it.
sentences.chinese: 洛山磯的警察逮捕了他，新聞界大肆宣揚。

sentences.english: The spokesman finally disclosed the facts to the press.
sentences.chinese: 發言人最終向新聞界公開了事實真相。

sentences.english: Politics and minefields, press and P.
The press has often reported that I led a revolt against Knudsen.
sentences.chinese: 新聞界經常報道說，我帶頭反抗努森。

definition: to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
to deliver/to send a letter/a letter (of complaint, opinion etc)
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
